Connect to Dropbox

      

      

          
 
               
          

          
 Dropbox is an online file sharing service that allows you to store your files on the cloud and to synchronize them across several computers and devices. 

          
 If you currently have a Dropbox account, here you can connect this interface to Dropbox. This will allow you to access files stored there directly from this interface, for retrieval, modification and fabrication. 

          
 Please click on the botton bellow to connect this interface to Dropbox. You will be taken to the Dropbox website, which will ask you if this interface is allowed to access your accont. After you confirm this, you will be taken back to this interface. 


          

          

              
Popups and security

              Your browser may prevent this page from opening a window to Dropbox. If that's the case, make sure you follow the correct procedure to allow popups opening for this page, then click on the button again.

 Motion 
 


 This panel allows you to configure the basic parameters of motion control. 


 The most important is probably the steps per millimeter paramaters, which allows your machine to move the exact distance you request in each axis 







    
Steps per millimeter

    

        

            
  About 

            
 When you control your machine, you ( or your control software ) gives it instructions to move to given positions, in millimeters 

            
 However, when your board actually controls a given axis, it does so by sending steps 

            
 You need to know, or calculate, the ratio of steps per millimeter, so that your machine will be capable of moving the correct distance 

            
 This calculation depends on your motors, drivers, and drive system ( you can watch  this guide on youtube  to learn more ) 

        

        
 Manual settings 

        
 If you already know your values, you can set them manually here

 Wizards 
 
        
 These wizards help you figure out the correct values if you don't know them 

        
 If you know the properties of your mechanical system ( pitches, microstepping, reductions etc ), you can input those to find the right value :

        
  

        
 If you do not know some of the properties of your mechanical system, you can also figure the values out by measuring the current movement distances, then from them the wizard will deduce the right value : 

        
 

        

            

                
 Accuracy 

                
 Finding the values by measuring ( with the proportional wizard ) will only be as accurate as your measurements 

                
 It is very likely that the values you will find will not be perfectly correct, but just a good approximation 

                
 Only calculating the values, either by using the calculator wizard, or manually, will give you the exact right values

Machine information

    

        

            

                
 Firmware version 
 

            
    
            

                
 IP Address 
 

            
    
        

    






    
Machine name

    

        

            
 No machine name 

            
 This machine does not have a name. It is usually a good idea to name your machine, it helps this interface in keeping track of it, and helps you discerning machines if you have several of them. 

            
 If you do not give this machine a name, it will be identified by it's IPaddress in this interface 

        

        

        

            

              

                
                

                    

                        

                        
                        

                            
                        

                    
 
                    

                      
 The machine name is used to recognize machines in networks where multiple machines are present 

                      
 It is recommended that you set one even if you only have one machine 

                    
  
                    
 Only letters and numbers and the underscore character are valid in machine names

      Connect to Dropbox
      
      
      
      
      
          
       
               
          
      
          
       Dropbox is an online file sharing service that allows you to store your files on the cloud and to synchronize them across several computers and devices. 
      
          
       If you currently have a Dropbox account, here you can connect this interface to Dropbox. This will allow you to access files stored there directly from this interface, for retrieval, modification and fabrication. 
      
          
       Please click on the botton bellow to connect this interface to Dropbox. You will be taken to the Dropbox website, which will ask you if this interface is allowed to access your accont. After you confirm this, you will be taken back to this interface. 
      

          
      
          
      
              
      Popups and security
      
              Your browser may prevent this page from opening a window to Dropbox. If that's the case, make sure you follow the correct procedure to allow popups opening for this page, then click on the button again.
